jsdp.sdp.impl.multidimensional

Class BackwardRecursionImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • jsdp.sdp.Recursion
      • jsdp.sdp.BackwardRecursion
        • jsdp.sdp.impl.multidimensional.BackwardRecursionImpl

  • public class BackwardRecursionImpl
extends BackwardRecursion
    A concrete implementation of a backward recursion procedure to compute (s,S) policy parameters.
    Author:
    Roberto Rossi

    • Constructor Detail

      • BackwardRecursionImpl

        public BackwardRecursionImpl(umontreal.ssj.probdistmulti.DiscreteDistributionIntMulti[] demand,
                             ImmediateValueFunction<State,Action,java.lang.Double> immediateValueFunction,
                             RandomOutcomeFunction<State,Action,double[]> randomOutcomeFunction,
                             java.util.function.Function<State,java.util.ArrayList<Action>> buildActionList,
                             java.util.function.Function<State,Action> idempotentAction,
                             SamplingScheme samplingScheme,
                             int maxSampleSize)
        Creates an instance of the problem and initialises state space, transition probability and value repository.
        Parameters:
        demand - the distribution of random demand in each period, an array of Distribution.
        immediateValueFunction - the immediate value function.
        randomOutcomeFunction - the random outcome function.
        buildActionList - the action list builder.
        idempotentAction - the idempotent action; i.e. an action that leaves the system in the same state from period t to period t+1.
        samplingScheme - the sampling scheme adopted.
        maxSampleSize - the maximum sample size.
